intro: Corydalis ohii, commonly known as the Appalachian fawnlily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has slender, branched stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Corydalis ohii is a short-lived perennial that plays an important role in its native ecosystem.
